positive_examples: This is an example of use after free attack.
The use after free attack demonstrated clear characteristics.
We observed use after free attack in this context.
A typical case of use after free attack would involve these features.
The concept of use after free attack applies here.
An attack that exploits memory that has been freed but is still being referenced by the program.
negative_examples: This is an example of buffer overflow attack, not use after free attack.
This represents memory corruption attack in general.
The document was filed in the cabinet.
She walked to the store to buy groceries.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: BufferOverflowAttack, or other types of MemoryCorruptionAttack

definition: A memory corruption exploit that accesses memory after it has been freed.
